functions.cellular_process: HDAC6 directly interacts with and deacetylates the DNA mismatch repair (MMR) protein MutL homolog 1 (MLH1) in the nucleus.
functions.effect_description: The deacetylation of MLH1 by HDAC6 disrupts the formation of the essential MutSα–MutLα recognition complex (MSH2-MSH6 and MLH1-PMS2). This disruption impairs the cell's ability to identify and repair DNA mismatches, leading to genomic instability and tolerance to certain DNA damaging agents.
biological_consequence: HDAC6 interacts with MLH1 → HDAC6 deacetylates MLH1 at specific lysine residues → Deacetylated MLH1 is unable to efficiently assemble with the MutSα complex → Formation of the MutSα–MutLα complex is blocked → DNA mismatch repair is impaired → Cell develops tolerance to DNA damage.
specific_effects: HDAC6 deacetylates MLH1 both in vitro and in vivo.
Deacetylation of MLH1 specifically blocks the assembly of the MutSα–MutLα complex.
A deacetylation-mimicking mutant of MLH1 confers resistance to the DNA damaging agent 6-thioguanine (6-TG).

evidence.paper_title: HDAC6 regulates DNA damage response via deacetylating MLH1
evidence.relevant_quote: Overall, our findings suggest that the MutSα-MutLα complex serves as a sensor for DNA damage response and that HDAC6 disrupts the MutSα-MutLα complex by deacetylation of MLH1, leading to the tolerance of DNA damage.
